fascia noun [C]
(BUILDING)
a flat piece of material under the edge of a roof, especially one that covers the ends of the rafters (= the large sloping pieces of wood that support the roof)

fascia noun [C]
(MEDICAL)
medical
  specialized a layer of strong, stretchy tissue that covers, separates, or holds together different organs, muscles, blood vessels, and nerves
